Package autumn.lang.compiler

Class CompiledProgram

java.lang.Object
autumn.lang.compiler.CompiledProgram
public final class CompiledProgram extends Object
An instance of this class is a compiled Autumn program.
Author:
Mackenzie High

  • Constructor Details

    • CompiledProgram

      public CompiledProgram(String main_class, List<ClassFile> classes)
      Constructor.

      The main-class parameter must be null, if no entry-point is specified. For example, this would occur when the compiled program is a library only.

      The dependency files will be added to the generated generated Jar file's manifest.

      Parameters:
      main_class - is the name of the class that contains the program's entry-point.
      classes - are the classes that the compiled program is composed of.

    • CompiledProgram

      public CompiledProgram(CompiledProgram program, List<URL> libraries)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      program - is the original compiled program.
      libraries - are the paths to libraries that the program relies upon.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if program is null.
      NullPointerException - if libraries is null.

  • Method Details

    • mainClass

      public String mainClass()
      This method retrieves the name of the module that contains the entry-point.

      This is the fully-qualified name as it would appear in source code.

      Returns:
      the aforedescribed name (may be null).

    • classes

      public List<ClassFile> classes()
      This method retrieves the class-files that are part of the compiled program.
      Returns:
      the program's class-files.

    • libraries

      public List<URL> libraries()
      This method retrieves the list of libraries that this program relies upon.
      Returns:
      an immutable list containing the URLs of the aforesaid libraries.

    • jar

      public void jar(File path) throws IOException
      This method writes this compiled program to a specified JAR file.

      If the JAR already exists, then it will be overwritten. If the JAR does not exist, then it will be created.

      Parameters:
      path - is the path to the new jar file.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • load

      public DynamicLoader load(ClassLoader parent)
      This method creates a new class-loader and uses it to load this program.
      Parameters:
      parent - is the parent of the new class-loader.
      Returns:
      the newly created class-loader with this program loaded into it.

    • load

      public DynamicLoader load()
      This method creates a new class-loader and uses it to load this program.

      Note: The parent of the new class-loader is the system's class-loader.

      Returns:
      the newly created class-loader with this program loaded into it.
